title: Sanji Will Damage Uranus/Mother Flame Like the Ark Maxim
author: Worstgen Forum User
theoryText: There are numerous parallels between Imu and Enel throughout the series. Just as Sanji sabotaged the Ark Maxim during the Skypiea arc to hinder Enel's plans, it would be fitting and thematically consistent for Sanji to play a similar role against Imu by damaging Uranus or the Mother Flame, breaking its gears and hindering Imu's goals in the final saga.
evidencePoints: Sanji successfully sabotaged the Ark Maxim's main engine in Episode 185
Parallels exist between Enel's god complex and Imu's world-ruler status
Both Enel and Imu have access to advanced/ancient technology (Ark Maxim and potential Ancient Weapons)
Sanji's tactical intelligence and ability to work behind enemy lines
The Ark Maxim may be inspired by or connected to the Ancient Weapon Uranus
communityReception: Mixed - interesting parallel but highly speculative

title: How Exactly Did Sanji Sabotage the Ark Maxim?
author: Various Community Members
theoryText: While it's confirmed that Sanji sabotaged the Ark Maxim's main engine during his infiltration, the exact method he used has never been explicitly shown in either the manga or anime. Theories range from: (1) Sanji physically kicked and damaged critical engine components, (2) He disconnected vital electrical systems, (3) He sabotaged the gold conducting systems, or (4) He damaged the dial-based propulsion mechanisms. The speed at which he accomplished this while also planning the rescue suggests either exceptional technical knowledge or very effective targeted destruction.
evidencePoints: Sanji split up from Usopp supposedly to maximize rescue chances, giving him time alone to sabotage
The ship's malfunctions occurred immediately after Sanji collapsed, suggesting recent damage
Enel's frustration indicates the damage was significant despite backup systems
Sanji had no apparent technical training, suggesting physical sabotage rather than technical hacking
The black clouds stopped and electrical connections failed, pointing to engine/power system damage
communityReception: Widely discussed but no consensus on exact method
